dt: {bc}a noncommissioned officer ranking in the army above a private first class and below a sergeant and in the marine {a_link|corps} above a lance corporal and below a sergeant

et: borrowed from Middle French, "lowest noncommissioned officer," alteration (by association with {it}cors, corps{/it} "body," Latin {it}corporālis{/it} "of the body") of {it}caporal,{/it} borrowed from Italian {it}caporale{/it} "leader of a small military unit," probably from Medieval Latin {it}capor-, capur-,{/it} restructuring of Latin {it}capit-{/it} (stem of {it}caput{/it} "head") + Italian {it}-ale,{/it} noun and adjective suffix, going back to Latin {it}-ālis{/it} {et_link|-al:1|-al:1} {ma}{mat|head:1|}{/ma}
shortdef: a noncommissioned officer ranking in the army above a private first class and below a sergeant and in the marine corps above a lance corporal and below a sergeant

dt: {bc}of, relating to, or affecting the body

et: Middle English {it}corporel, corporal,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French & Latin; Anglo-French {it}corporel,{/it} borrowed from Latin {it}corporālis{/it} "of the body, corporeal," from {it}corpor-, corpus{/it} "body" + {it}-ālis{/it} {et_link|-al:1|-al:1} {ma}{mat|midriff|}{/ma}
shortdef: of, relating to, or affecting the body

dt: {bc}a linen cloth on which the eucharistic elements are placed

et: Middle English {it}corporalle,{/it} borrowed from Anglo-French & Medieval Latin; Anglo-French {it}corporal,{/it} borrowed from Medieval Latin {it}corporāle{/it} (probably originally as modifying {it}linteāmen{/it} "linen cloth" or a word of similar sense), from neuter of Latin {it}corporālis{/it} "of the body, corporeal" (alluding to the belief that the eucharistic elements are the body of Christ) {ma}{mat|corporal:2|}{/ma}
shortdef: a linen cloth on which the eucharistic elements are placed

dt: {bc}the small detachment commanded by a corporal

shortdef: the small detachment commanded by a corporal

dt.t: The school banned {it}corporal punishment{/it} many years ago.

shortdef: punishment that involves hitting someone : physical punishment

dt: {bc}an enlisted man in the marine corps ranking above a private first class and below a corporal

et: {it}lance{/it} (as in obsolete {it}lancepesade{/it} lance corporal, from Middle French {it}lancepessade{/it})
shortdef: an enlisted man in the marine corps ranking above a private first class and below a corporal
